intro: Allosorus leucomelas, commonly known as the white-spotted groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-white, woolly leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow and bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Allosorus leucomelas is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
